Instruction: In a small bowl, mix together salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and brown sugar to make the dry rub.
Remove the membrane from the back of the ribs if necessary.
Rub the dry rub all over the pork ribs, ensuring they are evenly coated.
Place the seasoned ribs on a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil.
Pour apple cider vinegar over the ribs, then tightly cover the baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Bake the ribs in the preheated oven for 2.5 to 3 hours, or until they are tender and cooked through.
Once the ribs are cooked, remove them from the oven and uncover them.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Brush the ribs generously with barbecue sauce on both sides.
Place the ribs on the grill and cook for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until they are nicely charred and caramelized.
Transfer the ribs to a cutting board and let them rest for a few minutes.
Cut the ribs between the bones into individual portions.
Serve the pork ribs hot, with extra barbecue sauce on the side if desired.
